channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bus stop F - Countdown unit not working, 18th July
item.description:
Bus stop F - Countdown unit not working Next to The Portland Hospital.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 205-207, Great Portland Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and private property dumped on the public highway, 18th July
item.description:
Frequent flytipping under the bridge but the horsebox stuffed full of pallets and the VW camper van are permanent fixtures. The latter has not moved for at least six years. The horsebox has been dumped here a few months. I have some things I'd like to store in a shed but don't have the space, and would to store it for free until at least 2034. I can just drag my shed onto the kerb and leave it there, yeah? Ok cool.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fresh paint in middle of road., 18th July
item.description:
An upside down paint pot in the middle of entrance to car park; I moved it so a car wouldn’t hit it. The paint was already spilt. I stupidly didn’t take a before pic. Only after I thought to report it. A mattress. Hoover. This area is always a mess. Why can’t the bush be removed and a bricked bin house be installed. Now the new flats will no doubt cause more issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29,31,33,35, Ann Moss Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat on 34 floor leaving garbage in communal area, 18th July
item.description:
A certain unit on our floor is leaving trash consistently in the communal area of the floor. We know the unit. Management know the unit. Issue is now ongoing for 2+ months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Worship Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Cars doing U-turn on Graham Road is unsafe, 18th July
item.description:
Cars unable to turn towards Hackney Central from Greenwood Road simply do a U-turn after turning west, which causes traffic and today caused a crash involving a car going through a wall and almost hitting a house. Just let them turn east for safeties sake.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Groups of people between 10 and 20 all day and most of the night drinking and taking drugs on the street and blocking the footpath their cars are blocking the road and cycle path, this is every day this has been going on over a year and it getting worse, this off licence is opened late at night attracting antisocial behavior to local residents. There is large groups range from 20,30,40, Nigerians, jamaican's, young teenagers selling drugs drinking alcohol on the public streets sitting on the walls all Hours, residence feel unsafe of a night. The local Turkish off licence has become a community hub for anti-social behavior. Hackney Council enforcement teams need to patrol or stick up CCTV. This has been going on for over two years now and nothing has been addressed., 18th July
item.description:
Large group of black males gathering on a daily occurrence drinking alcohol from the local off-licence across the road smoking drugs and selling drugs on street corner. Residence and families feel intimidated and unsafe. This is antisocial behavior.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This car has no back window - been smashed in, 18th July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London
